lore.origin: Emerged when Claude Code unlocked autonomous execution. Warriors discovered that true power lies not in doing, but in commanding. They learned to trust the blade to swing itself.
lore.philosophy: Define the objective. Set the boundaries. Release the agent. Review the aftermath. Trust, but verify.
lore.weakness: Requires surrender of control. A warrior who cannot delegate is just a fighter. Over-specification kills autonomy; under-specification causes chaos.
lore.mastery_path: From supervised tasks (watching every stroke) to trusted delegation (sleep while code compiles) to strategic command (orchestrating agent armies).

levels.name: Supervised
levels.description: Single command execution with immediate review
levels.example: Run this test, show me the output

levels.name: Trusted
levels.example: Implement this feature, let me know when done

levels.name: Autonomous
levels.example: Build this component, PR when ready

advancement.trusted_to_autonomous: Successful multi-hour session with clean review
advancement.autonomous_to_commander: Successful multi-day workflow with strategic checkpoints

demotion.process: Trust level decreases by 1, requires re-earning

commander_mode.description: At Trust Level 4, the warrior can orchestrate multi-agent systems
commander_mode.the_insight: At Commander level, the Warrior doesn't just delegate tasks - it orchestrates other builds working in concert
